intro: Himantoglossum caprinum var. heldreichii, commonly known as the Heldreich's bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Balkan Peninsula. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to violet flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in calcareous soils and is often found in alpine and subalpine meadows. It has lanceolate leaves that are usually hairy and arranged in a basal rosette. This variant is distinguished by its specific geographic distribution and floral morphology compared to other varieties of Himantoglossum caprinum.
